p:
The following formula was used to determine the amount of solvent to be added for making the extract solution for antibacterial activity test.
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$ \mathrm{Amount}\ \mathrm{of}\ \mathrm{solvent}\ \mathrm{to}\ \mathrm{be}\ \mathrm{added}=\frac{100\times \mathrm{amount}\ \mathrm{of}\ \mathrm{extract}\ \mathrm{obtained}}{\mathrm{amount}\ \mathrm{of}\ \mathrm{plant}\ \mathrm{powder}\ \mathrm{used}} $$\end{document}
Amount of solvent to
be
added =
100 Ã— amount of extract obtained
amount of plant powder used
